Reviews.Title: Loving it so far! TV needs configured - 5 minute job.
Reviews.Author: Prithviraj Sharan "Reviews from my girlfriend...
Reviews.Content: I agonized a lot before buying this TV. And in the end price won me over - over $500 cheaper than anything good that Samsung or Panasonic offered. The way I figured, $500 "saved" here can be used towards XBOX One in a few months. Reading all these reviews helped sway my decision. I also really wanted a Plasma as I don't like the picture quality of LED/LCD.The TV is ginormous, and I love it! There is minimal branding - only a small LG logo on front. I like the minimalistic design. There are only 2 HDMI ports but I don't care as I use one for cable box (which will go into XBOX eventually) and the other for a Sony Blu Ray player which also streams Amazon Prime, Netflix, YouTube, etc.Once you get your TV consider configuring it to the following: Aspect Ratio: Set by Program Energy Saving: Off Picture Mode: Expert 1 Contrast: 91 Brightness: 48 H. Sharp: 15 V. Sharp: 15 Color: 57 Tint: 0Expert Control Dynamic Contrast: Off Color Gamut: Standard Edge Enhancer: Off Color Filter: Off Gamma: 2.4 Color Temperature: Medium Method: 2 Points Pattern: Outer Points: High Red: 14 Green: -12 Blue: -10I never switch picture modes. More information:  [...]

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price, one noticeable problem.
Reviews.Author: B. Paddock
Reviews.Content: So far TV is great!  This will be my 4th 60 inch tv in about a month, first was LG LED-couldn't handle dark scenes(screen was fading in and out from really dark to really light) 2nd was a Samsung 60 inch plasma, great picture but terrible buzzing that could be heard from far away.  3rd was Vizio, cool smart tv with overall great picture but had really bad uniformity issues when there was a dark scene, you could see these light spots around the edges of the screen that extended towards the middle of the screen, very annoying and distracted from what was on the screen.  So here we are 4th tv, I am not interested in a smart tv, all I want is picture quality.  So far this tv is great, I set it up with the THX optimizer program (if you buy Terminator 2 on Bluray it has that program on it, I picked it up for 5 buck on amazon). I also use the website "picture perfect TV" which steps you through all the picture settings to get the optimal picture (according to them).  I like their settings and think they look great.  This is their website [...]  Picture quality is great, black levels are really nice and there are no uniformity issues (light spots on dark screen) .  There is no buzzing sound coming from this plasma tv, which is what made me take back the samsung.  You can watch this tv from any angle and it looks great, I noticed the Vizio would wash out pretty bad at different angles due to it being an Edge Lit LED.  This tv handles darkness very well, it doesn't fade in or out during dark scenes in a movie.  Colors on this TV are nice and vibrant, again, picture quality is great.  2 HDMI ports is kind of a bummer but you can buy a 10 dollar switcher here on amazon to bump that up to 4 total so thats not really an issues.  The TV has a color wash program so if you accidentally leave something paused for too long or watch ESPN with the ticker going across the bottom of the screen all day you can run this program to "was away" anything that is burnt in.  It also has a pixel "orbiter" mode which will shift the picture on the TV about every 2 minutes to avoid burn in.  You can really only notice the orbiter if you are watching a still screen.  From everything I have read plasma burn in isn't really an issue anymore, you have to do something extreme to cause it, like leaving your tv on and paused for a week.  As far as picture quality goes, plasma is the way to go, I have read and watched plenty of expert reviews that say plasma cannot be beat and I believe it.  Out of the box the 2 plasmas I have bought have looked way better than the 2 LED's(which are really LCD tvs lit by LED lights but they call them LED TV's because they sound newer and can charge extra $$$ for them).  Sound quality for this tv is pretty good for being a flat screen, not much bass but that is how tv's are nowadays, you will need a surround sound system or sound bar to really enjoy your movies.  We pull the shades in the room that the tv is in to reduce the glare.  This tv does have a mirror like look to the screen when the tv is off so it is way more reflective then the LCD LED tvs.  This would probably be the only deal breaker for me, if you are putting this TV in a room that has lots of sunlight in front of the TV and you don't have any shades to pull. I personally could not enjoy the tv that way, because when we open the shades the glare is pretty bad, you can literally see yourself in this TV, so you either need to invest in some blackout shades or only watch tv at night!  That would be the only negative to this TV so far. It is really slim (looks as slim as the LCD LED TV's) but it still way heavier.  I think this TV is around 98 lbs where the LED tv's are around 60.  One more thing about LED tv's, another one of the things that are attractive about them is they are the most energy efficient, but not by much.  Most new Edge lit LED tvs this size use about $14-$25 PER YEAR according to the energy star sticker on the TV.  This TV uses $34 PER YEAR so to me that is still pretty great.  It gets a little warm when its on but it doesn't put off heat like old plasma tv's used to.  To me $34 PER YEAR is a non-issue.  I bought this from amazon.com for$750 free shipping no taxes, it was a great deal!  The company that delivered the TV was JB Hunt and they did a great job.  They called 2 days before the TV was going to be delivered to setup up a delivery time, and then they called 30 minutes before they arrived.  The guys unboxed the TV for me and put the stand together, and put the tv on my TV stand, all at no cost to me!  They asked me if I wanted to keep the box because they would haul it away for free but I said yes, I will keep the box.  The original box is the best way to transport your tv, whether you are moving or sending it back because of a defect.  In summary I will say it again, picture quality is great, that is my #1 concern and so far no complaints!  I will update this review if it starts doing something strange.UPDATE 9-2-2013Apparently all LG TV's have a very annoying "feature" that cannot be turned off.  The LG LED TV I bought and this LG plasma do the same thing.  If you set your brightness settings to less than 50 your screen will turn off when it is an all black screen.  Let me explain.  The best example I can give is opening credits to a movie (one  name in white letters displayed on an all black screen.  When the movie will slowly fade from one name to another the tv screen will turn off in between names.  This is not really noticeable during the day but at night it is pretty distracting.  You get a TV off to TV on kind of flicker on the screen.  I researched this problem and it sounds like LG tv's do this so that the company can boost their contrast ratio numbers.  When you think about it TV OFF is the ultimate black level so they can legally boast very high contrast ratios.  It is also very noticeable between "fade to black" scene changes during a movie.  I have contacted LG about this problem and they just tip-toed around the problem, they just told me to upgrade the firmware on the TV, when I asked them what was included in the upgrade they said we can't divulge that information, didn't know I was dealing with the FBI of flatscreen companies, I have a feeling it was a more "important" way of saying "we don't know."  I know an easy solution to this problem would be to set the brightness back to 50 or above, but due to the room my tv is in, that is way too bright and really washes out the picture.  That being said we will be keeping the tv.  This is not a big enough problem to return it and for $750 this is a pretty small problem compared to others I have experienced.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Plasma!
Reviews.Author: Osirus
Reviews.Content: I just bought this TV yesterday and it's definitely a beast! I paid 920 for it at hhgregg. This is my first 60" TV and I'm very glad that I decided to get this size as opposed to a 50" or 55". Viewing angles are excellent and the colors are insanely gorgeous.Unfortunately, this TV refuses to play videos of any kind off of the USB port. I am NOT happy about this!The picture wasn't all that great out of the box and I needed to do some calibration to get a picture that I wanted. I recommend that you consider doing the same to get the most out of your new plasma.Here are the settings that I used:Picture Mode: Expert 1Energy Saving: OffPanel Light: 90Contrast: 88Brightness:50H. Sharp: 22V. Sharp: 22Color: 48Tint: 0Now select Expert controlDynamic Contrast: OffColor Gamut: StandardEdge Enhancer: OnColor Filter: OffGamma: 2.2Color Temperature: MediumMethod: 2 PointsPattern: OuterPoints: HighRed: +14Green: -10Blue: -10You may or may not like these settings but I hope they will assist you in achieving a better picture. This Plasma has an amazing picture. If you are in the market for one beast of a TV, you should strongly consider this one.Happy shopping and may God bless you all.*** 4/25/14 EDIT:Well, I have had this TV for just over a year and it's been a great TV. I do, however, have the Destination America and History Channel logos permanently burned into my TV in the lower right hand corner and upper right hand corner of my screen respectively. I knew this might happen when I got the TV and it's not that big of a deal I guess. You can only see the burned-in images on a white background.It's still a stunningly beautiful TV with stunning colors. I'm still glad I got it!

Reviews.Title: A True Analog Player in a Digital World...and that's a good thing
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer:I have owned three HDTVs prior to this purchase: a Hitachi 42" plasma 1080i, a Samsung 52" LCD 1080p, and a Panasonic 42" plasma 1080p, all of which are models manufactured in 2006 or older.  Purchasing an HDTV, much like purchasing other expensive electronics like a cell phone, is a very personal decision.  I tend to like plasmas more than LED-LCD technology, but the technology is getting so good that I definitely considered both this time around.  With that said, I ultimately bought this LG model for the "bang for the buck" factor.Pros:- Cost: For a sub $1,000 600hz 1080p plasma, it can't be beat.  Like other reviewers, I paid a lot less for this TV locally than I could find anywhere on the web, so be sure to shop around.- Picture quality - with a little tweaking on initial TV setup, the picture comes alive.  I've tested the picture with Blu-Ray, streaming Netflix and Amazon Instant Video on my Roku, and normal HDTV cable via a basic HDTV Comcast cable box.  Picture quality is consistent and true to form.  I won't be using this TV for video games, so I can't speak to picture quality there.  Blacks are very "true".  Watching movies on this thing is making for a great theater experience.- Form factor - the TV is incredibly thin for a plasma; I cannot wait to mount it to my wall.  It is not noisy at all either, and it's designed for the minimalist in mind.  The TV stand pivots left and right as well.- Customizability - great for those that like to tinker with advanced picture settings, in addition to others.  I'm very surprised at the amount of options the user is able to adjust.- Plasma - no issues with shadow or flashlight effectsCons:- Glare: I would not recommend placing this TV in well-lit, or even modestly-lit rooms.  It is best watched with the lights completely off.  The screen does not have any anti-glare capability, and any hint of light will project on the screen unless you are viewing from an angle that does not entail the projected light.  This is an unfortunate, but fairly standard issue with plasma screens, although I typically find this issue in LED-LCD screens as well (just not as prominent).- No SMART functionality (no built in apps, etc.)Other:I cannot comment on the sound, as I don't use it (I have a 5.1 surround sound system).  Also I won't list minimal HDMI inputs as a negative, since I run everything through my HDMI-based receiver.  While I've only owned the TV a week, I have not experienced any of the issues that others have reported.Overall:An incredible value.  This is basically a gigantic monitor that can hang on your wall; ideal for those that have everything else (A/V components, streaming device, sound system, etc.) and for those who do not care to pay the extra options that typically come standard on a TV these days.  I ultimately see myself keeping this TV in the rotation for my home; eventually phasing out my older two models (42" plasma and 52" LCD models) completely and buying something new again in a few years, since HDTV technology continues to rapidly evolve.  Coming from a 52", this TV has completely transformed my living room (about 19' x 15' in size) for the better when it comes to in-home entertainment.Bottom Line:BUY THIS HDTV if you are partial to plasmas, you have a sound system or sound bar, and you prioritize size and picture quality.  Your wallet will thank you!

Reviews.Title: 1 week out of the box
Reviews.Author: J. M. Timlin
Reviews.Content: So let’s start this off by saying that I spent weeks looking over TVs.  On-line, at “The Big Screen Store”, Target, Best Buy, everywhere.  I looked at Plasma and LED TV’s and I looked at everything from 52 to 60 inches.  I was in the market for a new one after my Samsung 50 inch plasma died on me (see my review on that if you’d like).  This TV came up time and time again as a great minimalist TV.  So I eventually bought it... The one negative I have for this is the input/output scheme.  The TV only has two HDMI ports on it (which is not a big deal for me personally as I have a Blu-ray/sound system that handles two inputs also, but for anyone reading this be warned) and the fact that your only audio output is the optic audio port.  So that is a little on the annoying side but not deal breaker.  Moving forward.  There are many positives about this TV.  First, my previous TV was the 50 inch I had before.  Maybe it never dawned on me til I saw it at my house, but the 60 inch is huge, and it looks even bigger due to the sleek design of the thing.  It has minimal signage, and the border is minimal around the TV as well.  The stand is simple, the power controls are on the same side of the TV as the input/output jacks, and everything just flows together very seamlessly.On to what really matters, the picture quality.  Odds are if you are buying a plasma, you have either A owned one before, or B heard that they offer superior picture quality and refresh rates.  All of which is absolutely true with this TV.  The plasma contrast ratio’s beat out just about everything I have seen.  Out of the box, this TV picture quality is about average for most TVs out of the box.  I spent about a half hour tweaking and changing the various parts of the overall picture quality.  Ended up landing on the following settings:Aspect Ratio: 16:9Energy Saving: OffPicture Mode: Expert 1Contrast: 90Brightness: 51H. Sharp: 15V. Sharp: 15Color: 60Tint: 0Expert ControlDynamic Contrast: OffColor Gamut: StandardEdge Enhancer: OffColor Filter: OffGamma: 2.4Color Temperature: MediumMethod: 2 PointsPattern: OuterPoints: HighRed: 12Green: -10Blue: -8These settings produce a very rich color and a sort of organic texture to the scheme; especially in video games.  There is virtually no motion blur or anything even resembling it.  This TV looks great for sports, games, and movies; and for the price, it’s virtually unbeatable.  If you own an xbox, roku, playstation, or Blu-ray player with app configurations, this TV is fantastic (as it is not a smart TV). I will update again around the 3 month mark

Reviews.Title: Super TV if you have SMART equipment and all you care for is excellent picture
Reviews.Author: Ullas Bhai "Novo Reveuaxeur"
Reviews.Content: There is a lot of hullabaloo over having a smart TV. I decided for this UNsmart LG and all I can say is it's the best decision I made in all of last year.* If you have an endless supply of money, of course this review is not worth reading. If you are a regular middle class person looking for a good (should I say great) quality TV please read ahead.I spent hours researching the right TV. My requirements were pretty simple : A great picture quality. I usually don't care for the bells and whistles, so I need a plain simple TV with a great picture quality, but I wanted to keep it as close to a 1000 as possible. I made the decision between Panasonic Plasma vs Sharp LED vs this unit. I am just so glad I did. It cost me ~800.Kudos to amazon for the low price guarantee. I had it ordered and the price fell 50$ and they just refunded it to me.Who should buy this- If you have a lot of smart equipment at home (console, bluray player or satellite receiver etc.) and don't need a smart TV, but just a great picture to run all those smart babies- If you are a quasi-videophile but don't have a very deep pocket- If you can live with only 2 HDMI portsThis is an amazing screen. Picture quality is so awesome that it throws some 1500$ unit out the window.  If all you care for is a great picture quality look no further.I am a big sony fan and was a little weary, but I can only say that I am glad I put my loyalty aside and went with this unit. Great work LG!!

Reviews.Title: What a picture!
Reviews.Author: KC Video @ Amteurvideoediting.com "Amateur Vi...
Reviews.Content: After doing a lot of research and reading a lot of reviews I decided to go with the LG and it was the best decision. The choice between plasma or LCD/LED wasn't a big deal for me.  Unless I was going to great a great deal & black levels with LED, plasma was always my first choice.  3D I didn't need as well as all the smart features as I already have that with my blue ray player and PS3. So skipping these features, specially if you already have them can save you a few hundred dollars.  Most of them are useless as well.  Skype would have been the only real feature that I would have preferred built in.  Since I have a home theater PC connected to the tv, that certainly wasn't a deal breaker. So ultimately I was looking for a big screen, with great picture quality & black levels at the cheapest price I could find. Why pay more right?My old tv was a Mitsubishi DLP 60in. I loved that tv. The reason why we replaced it with this was because the chip was beginning to go bad (white dots on the screen). While this is easily fixable at the cost of about $150 we decided to get a new one because Mitsubishi has since discontinued making DLP. The picture quality was great and because it was reflected onto a screen, it gave you that theater style picture. Also at the time it was the cheapest big screen for the least amount of money. $1100 for a 60in tv 6 years ago was a great deal. Specially since a 50in went for about $2500.So we certainly didn't want to step down in size. I looked at Panasonic and Samsung. The Pannys were my 1st choice. The only issue I had with Pannys were that some reviews were great (on model picture quality) while others weren't depending on the model you were looking to buy. A few of their base models have had there prices remain high because of their popularity. The funny thing though was that a few of their models also had bad reviews for picture quality and black levels. As far as the samsungs go, there were too many reviews complaining of a humming noise. Coming across the LG I read almost no bad reviews. The only one that was middle of the road was CNETS review of LG's plasma.Picture quality is great.  Follow some of the picture settings listed in other reviews here or on AVE forums. Out of the box the picture is good, but the few tweaks make it great.  Avatar used as a test looked awesome. The Dark Night really showed off great black levels. The sound quality from the Tv is actually really good. Surprisingly so. While I have a 7.1 set up, I don't always use the receiver when watching tv so this was a welcomed surprise.We got free shipping with the unit as we'll. it arrived safely and on time. Pilot Air freight brought the unit in the house, took it out of the box and tested it to make sure it worked.  Everything 100%. The only issue I had was my impatience waiting for the tv. Amazon and the shipping company certainly get high marks.Overall we are extremely happy and would recommend this tv to anyone.  Burn in is no longer a problem so I wouldn't worry about that.FANTASTIC TV!

Reviews.Title: Basic and beautiful.
Reviews.Author: Jared Burdick "JBurd"
Reviews.Content: If you need a smart TV with lots of bells and whistles, this is not the TV for you. This is a stripped down plasma TV with one key feature; a terrific picture.First and foremost, the picture. Most reliable sources will point you to plasma for the best possible picture. If you prefer the glassy (soap opera) style picture that 240hz LED's produce, you will not be happy with the plasma. Plasmas are not as bright as LED's and maintain a more traditional (albeit exceptionally sharp) picture. There is glare. I have a home with an open floorplan and this is in my living room. Direct light from the kitchen causes glare. If you have continuous direct light, you may not want to go this direction. If you are more interested in people that look real and movies that look like they do in the theater, this is a great TV. It is less than a 3rd of the cost of the Panasonic Plasma's; the picture is not as good as those. That said, for regular, non videophile type viewers, the picture is spectacular. Sports, video games and Blue Ray video are really amazing.There are only 2 HDMI inputs, one audio, component, optical and aux jack. If you have multiple components, you will need a HDMI switcher and if you don't have a blu-ray player or console with apps, you will probably want to pick up a Roku or comparable device.  I use Dish TV and a PS4 so I am completely covered and two HDMI's are all I need.  I also use an LG sound bar (LG Electronics NB3530A Sound Bar System) via optical cable. I have about 1500 sq ft in my living/kitchen area for the TV and soundbar and it is a perfect fit. Total investment is about $1100 and I coundn't be happier.Really, the primary issue for me will be how well the LG product holds up. Plasma cannot be treated like an LED and burn in, although mitigated on new models, is still possible. I have had terrific luck with Vizio and Sony, lousy luck with Samsung and LG. Although many people will argue about the small differences in picture quality. As an average consumer/viewer, I'm just as interested in longevity and the TV working the way it is supposed to. Only time will tell.

Reviews.Title: Football looks AMAZING on this PLASMA!
Reviews.Author: Darren Willis
Reviews.Content: WOW, I have had a 60" LCD TV (Sony, $4,500, in 2004) since 2004.  Never fully appreciated that it wasn't true 1080p, it was really a stretched version of 720p.  Still the HD looked great (so we thought).  I actually bought a 60" Samsung LED last summer and returned it after watching a DVR'd baseball game and DVR'd Football game.  The motion blur and "pixel outline cloud" around all the players drove me nuts.  I returned that TV to best buy in < 48 hours.  Been searching since last summer for a good "Sports" tv, my father in law has a 50" Samsung plasma which always looks great when we watch football..blah blah did the research and decided that Plasma was the way to go.  So found this exact model at a "mart" store this weekend for $648.00.  Bought it and put it in last night.  AMAZING picture, clarity, Colors were awesome, true black etc.  The setting the TV comes on is ECO, switch it to "Standard" and it looks better than an LED, way better than the $2,100 Samsung LED I had.Glare, don't worry about it.  When the TV's off sure it looks like a mirror, but when I was watching football and playing PS3 Battlefield 4 last night I never once noticed any of the 3 lamps on in the background.Truly the best TV decision I've ever made.  It's phenomenal.  No lag on PS3 at all either.Also bought the LG smart wifi Sound bar (the speakers that come with the TV are just barely adequate, will not cut it for movies or music at all)LG NB3730A 47-Inch Sound Bar With Wireless Subwoofer, Bluetooth, Internet ApplicationsA must buy!

Reviews.Title: Plasma is the way to go.
Reviews.Author: Chad Matzen
Reviews.Content: This TV is fantastic.  I have had LCD TVs for quite some time, but after reading about the picture benefits of plasma decided to give it a shot.  This television produces the most amazingly brilliant picture for sports and movies.  We no longer go to the theater for movies.  The blacks are deep, and the colors are extremely vibrant.  The 600Hz refresh rate eliminates any blurring from fast action.  The only issue with Plasma is the glass screen.  This does make the TV heavier, and also reflects light, so you do have to be careful of your light placement in the room.  Cheetah mounts offer great wall mounting options for this Television.

Reviews.Title: Really nice TV
Reviews.Author: Eric Stephenson
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice TV.  So far I haven't had any issues and I've had it for about 8 months.  The picture is really nice and the actual TV looks good as well.  I think the plasma picture is better than my LCD or even an LED.  There is more of a glare though so I wouldn't buy it for a room that has a lot of windows.  The only other negative is that it isn't a smart TV but that isn't a huge deal.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: g13sf
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic TV for the price. You can't beat plasma for sports, or anything that has a lot of action/motion. Plasma doesn't blur like LED/LCD TVs.This TV is surprisingly thin, most people will probably mistake it for an LED it's so thin!It's not a Smart TV and it only has 2 HDMI ports, but that's irrelevant. The money you save by not getting a TV with more HDMI ports and smart features you can roll over into an AppleTV/Roku (smart features with better performance) and a home theater system.I got this home theater system (B0077V88V8 which allows up to 4 HDMI devices, that then uses only 1 HDMI port on the TV. So you get much better sound than just the TV, and plenty of inputs.The picture is fantastic, I followed a mix of the suggestions from the first two reviews, but I'm sure I can tweak them even further.Edit 10/2/13: After about 3 weeks one of the pixels (about 1/4 of the way from the left, 1/3 from the top) got stuck as red. Called LG, they sent out a tech the next day who looked at it and determined that it needed to be replaced. So I'm getting a new TV in a week or so. So LG's warranty service was quite good in this respect.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Christopher Gilbert
Reviews.Content: I was not interested in a Smart TV or 3DTV. Why would I want apps on a smart TV that are clunky, slow, take awhile to navigate through when I can just hook up a computer or Apple TV? For the extra money for the Smart option (roughly $300) I'm more inclined to buy Apple TV for $100. That being said, this is the ideal TV for someone who is interested in a reasonably priced set that has an awesome picture, and decent menu/options. The sounds is ok- not perfect, but I hooked it up to a Vizio 5.1 sound bar using the Optical Sound Output. Very happy with that option.ProsPicture QualitySize is perfectBlack really looks blackConsOnly 1 Component Cable outputSound but can be remediated with attaching sound system.I recommend this for someone looking for a great-priced solid TV without expensive, often useless bells and whistles.

Reviews.Title: Best TV for the Dollar
Reviews.Author: Barley
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV with a lot of doubt in my mind as I've always owned LCD or LED TV's. Being a gamer, I was almost sure that I'd regret it, but I decided to take a chance anyway.Out of the box, The TV is pretty lackluster. Mostly due to the fact that the default picture settings aren't setup very well. So you'll want to make sure you setup the picture settings before you go and use the TV for viewing. You can find good recommendations for custom settings in some of the reviews on here or just by Googling.When I finally got around to watching a movie on it, I was blown away by how good it looked. Colors were very deep, blacks were true, picture was sharp, etc... Even when you play a lower quality video on the TV, it tends to just look better. I'd say that's more because it's a Plasma than anything though.But what about gamers? I must warn you that Image Retention is a very real thing. You gotta make sure after playing a game where a HUD stays up for extended periods of time, that you watch something like a movie afterwards. It's a pain, but hey, you knew what you were getting into. I also had read that people were reporting getting input lag on this model. I expected the worst when I first booted up my PS3/Xbox 360, but to be honest, I don't know what they're talking about as input lag is virtually non-existent on this TV. I've put more hours into gaming on this TV than movie watching, so I think I'd notice it by now.Final words on my experience with going to Plasma. Honestly, I like it. The TV gives off less heat than my LCD TV's (not the LED though), it just plain looks better and good luck finding a cheaper good quality 60" TV. My only tips are to make sure you break in the TV for the first 100 hours and as mentioned before, setup the picture before watching anything.Reasons for 4-stars instead of 5.- For people looking to just plug in the TV and go, there is a bit of setting up prior to doing that. It doesn't bother me, but I can see how it bothers some.- My TV came with 3 dead pixels. As with any TV, regardless of brand or model, there is a chance for this. Luckily, I can't see them if you sit more than 8 feet from the TV, so it doesn't really bother me.- The TV has some stupid power saver thing where if the brightness is below 50, whenever the screen turns black, it'll turn off the panel. As soon as something pops up, it turns it back on. It's only noticeable at night, but I do see it as a needless annoying feature.- There is a surprising lack of inputs on the back of the TV. It doesn't bother me as I have everything going through my home theatre, but I do see it as a weakness in this model.

Reviews.Title: Less than 6 months old and has issues
Reviews.Author: Michael McBrayer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV online due to the great reviews, and also its size. No way for me to purchase and bring home in my current vehicles. The reviews were great yet we had issues almost immediately with it randomly powering off. I contacted LG as it is under warranty but because I'm 25 miles South of Atlanta I'm not close enough so LG won't come service, I have to figure out how to get it to them. In the mean time the power down events increase. While on the LG site they beg me for a review. I write a similar review on the LG site (which has all glowing reviews) so naturally they REJECT my review. Now I know why they have so many great reviews. Suppress any negative ones.Here is my rejection email:Your opinion is very important to us and the LG community. We appreciate your taking the time to write a review on 60PN6500. Unfortunately your review did not meet our guidelines for posting on our site.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: Andrew Sherrard
Reviews.Content: I've only had this for  2 weeks so I can't say much about any longevity/quality yet. But The picture is incredible. After doing some googling for some calibration settings that I tweaked a little bit to my own liking. Not much though... Its great for movies at night!! Its HUGE!!! And I love it that way. If you have a receiver with multiple HDMI inputs the TV only having 2 inputs shouldn't be a problem. I'm pretty close to the TV and for its size it looks great. I had no dead pixels or any inconsistencies. It came in one piece and on the scheduled delivery date and time, very convenient. I have a PS3 so there was no need for a smart TV and to me there's no point in succumbing to the 3d fad/sales gimmick.I got an absolutely gorgeous picture, Massive screen, and Motion friendly TV. What more could I ask for. I love not seeing vertical white lines that are the lamps on the sides of LCD and LED tv's that I have notice on friends TV's. In dark scenes this TV shines! Although when completely black the TV either shuts off or something to that extent because it emits no light. Kind of cool at night though actually... but made me a little nervous the first time it happened. That's about the only thing that I have negative to say at this point.Side note but programming this to my yamaha receiver remote took the first LG code on the remote code list :) as well as the cable remote. Football games are so much better! Also just a word of advice if you move frequently... save the box and packaging. It will come in handy when you need to move this bad boy. Although its a pretty big box it could save you the price of a new TV!!! A trick I learned from my uncle.If you're looking to for the Big / Plasma /  Relatively Cheap / Great Picture you've found a match. Usually you have to sacrifice one of those to get the rest. But with this TV you can get all 4!!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV & Greatest Deal for a Plasma!!
Reviews.Author: JCV805
Reviews.Content: LG 60PN6500 60-Inch Plasma Just Awesome, just got it and I'm in Love with it. You can throw your money away if you want too, or spend wisely with this purchase. If you want 3d or a smart TV, get something else. I have no need for 3d and already have all the features of a smart TV on my PS3, with all the money you can save, get a good Blu-ray DVD Player which not only will you enjoy more, but have all the features of a smart TV. You can read hours of reviews, and no matter what brand, you will find good and bad reviews, the bottom line it's your money, and believe me when I tell you that this Plasma TV will be by far your best purchase ever, it's a Great Price for a Awesome TV.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Shopperx
Reviews.Content: Leo Laporte is huge on this thing. Star Trek is GREAT on this thing. Peter Gabriel concert DVD's look like they are happening in my living room! I have a cat who loves TV and Leo but now that Leo has a 60" head she is scared. She still likes "Sunny" though.But seriously, this is a nice TV! I love Plasmas.It's not a "Smart TV" but I have it hooked up to "Smart Stuff".Great value. great looking TV.I think I'm gonna buy a few more before they're illegal.

Reviews.Title: 60 Inch Plazma dream
Reviews.Author: John Rock
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about purchasing this tv after all of the reviews I read. My purchase was the best decision ever. The picture is fantastic. The ease of operation : simple. And the speakers are all not that bad. The sound that comes out is fantastic. Does it have the power to blow you away,no. It enough to say for the price it was an exceptional value. I would recommend it to anyone. Thanks LG for making a Plasma affordable and of good value.

Reviews.Title: "on the wall"
Reviews.Author: "The" Inspector
Reviews.Content: Right out of the box this thing is big. Hanging on the wall it looks like it is at home. We love it. The sound from the speakers for everyday viewing I find is more than adequate. I have had no issues with glare or reflections (looking at some of the other reviews this may be because of the mounting location.).  I have it hooked to a over the air antenna. The HD stations are more than impressive... they are AWESOME.... The other stations pictures are very nice as well. I also have it connected via 50ft. HDMI cable to remote computer for streaming video. Again.... AWESOME....For the price I found this Flat-Screen to be a bargain. If you are in the market for an affordable big screen. I would definitely put this one on the short list.

Reviews.Title: 60 inch lg. awesome!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazonian10
Reviews.Content: Trust me. Owned for 2 weeks so far. No problems. Functions great, picture is awesome. Can't complain nothing to complain about. I owned a 50 inch before and was looking for an upgrade. this tv did more than anticipated. Price can't beat.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased.
Reviews.Author: Jonnagabs
Reviews.Content: I recommend this TV to anyone wanting an excellent large screen plasma HDTV without all the added smart features that you can more cheaply obtain with an upgraded Blu Ray DVD player or streaming device.  Excellent product for the money.

Reviews.Title: Best Value in Plasma Big Screen Going...
Reviews.Author: John M. Chamberlain
Reviews.Content: As with most large purchases, I spent a considerable amount of time researching the acquisition of a new bigscreen.First decision was plasma or led. Plasma won for several reasons which I won't go into here.I am thoroughly impressed with the quality of this set in both its form and function. While it does not have all the bells and whistles, ala Smart TV et al, it is a beautiful piece of work. When combined with a "smart" blu-ray player, voila! it's pretty smart after all.Adjustments are many and varied, I was able to get a basically good picture using the presets, then able to tweak for a magnificent picture.Picture quality is superb and sound is more than adequate. I will probably be purchasing a soundbar system in the next few months, but for now it is more than adequate.I highly recommend including this set in your purchasing deliberations if in the market for a 60" HDTV. And, of course, including Amazon in your sourcing decisions as well.

Reviews.Title: Superb Picture
Reviews.Author: Tmanqz
Reviews.Content: This LG Plasma is awesome.The picture looked great out the box.Made adjustments and dialed the picture in even better in about 30 minutes.You truly cant beat a Plasma for picture quality, you would have to spend twice as much to get a picture like this from a LED.The price to picture quality makes this a winner.Sound is surprising good for flat panel tv. I use a HT system so I dont use the tv sound.Well packaged, no issues in transporting to home.Nice stand that swivels.Really no negatives, its exactly as advertised a DUMB TV with oustanding Plasma picture quality,If you want the smart stuff get a ROKUfor $45.00. Those things work better anyways then the so called Smart TVs.If you can get this at good price, buy it. Walmart sales LGPN5000 which is pretty much the same thing for $598.00..just doesnt have the picture wizard software [...]

Reviews.Title: Great value.
Reviews.Author: Kelsey Crockett
Reviews.Content: Superb for your Blu-Ray and HD Netflix streaming demands. This LG has served us well the last 6 months with no issues, and it is a real pleasure to watch. I just needed a high quality picture with no bells and whistles, and it's exactly what I got. I'm becoming increasingly loyal to LG as they continue to offer products as these. Pair it with a good sound bar and you will have a respectable home theater for under $1k. Thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: Anita Collins
Reviews.Content: I bought this television for my 89 year old mother.  It is beautiful.  The color is so clear and the sound is fantastic.  She loves this tv so much that I can hardly get her to shut if off at night and go to bed.  It is easy to assembly and it really does look great in the room.

Reviews.Title: Finally convinced my husband that all tvs didn't have to be Samsung
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Luke
Reviews.Content: We just replaced our 6 year old Samsung and we are very happy with this purchase. The delivery was so smooth and they even unpacked it and plugged it to to make sure there were no shipping issues. The price of this tv was such a bargain....even better than anything I found on all the Black Friday ads. Our old tv was a 1080 but there is something about this one that makes 1080 seem much much clearer. The 600hz makes a huge difference when watching action as there is no blur at all. I purchased this from Amazon and got free prime shipping and saved a ton in sales tax. This was a great purchase!

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Gregory Schneider
Reviews.Content: Very Happy with this purchase.  Great price and clarity. The only negitive is that in sunlight there is a glare.

Reviews.Title: Great Value in a 60 Inch HDTV
Reviews.Author: C. White "Chazzz"
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased to have taken the chance on ordering this TV from Amazon. The contrast ratio (white to black levels) are spectacular! Blacks are very black and the picture is plenty bright.I was pleasantly surprised at the sound quality given that there are no visible forward facing speakers. And if you are "of a certain age" you can turn on and adjust the "clear voice" in the audio menu that emphasizes the higher pitches to make voices clearer - though at the tradeoff of making the sound noticeably high pitched. But I found that setting the "clear voice" on and to "+1" instead of the default "+3" was a good compromise.I did initially run into one issue when connected to my Sony BluRay DVD player. The picture would appear to flash or lose sync when I was using my BluRay player to play video off the Internet. I experimented with the picture menu in the Blu Ray player and found a setting of the HDMI format that worked much better for the TV. Then the picture was perfect.The good:Great contrast ratio.Great resolution and size.Beautiful pictures (I use the "expert setting and tweak the picture settings just slightly).Cabinet barely bigger than the actual picture area.Wider viewing angle than Projection or LCD."Clear Voice" is good for those of us losing the top end of our hearing range.Optical Fiber output for Audio System - The very best way to connect to a modern Audio System.Could Use Improvement:Remote is a bit cluttered in its layout.I would like a rear analog audio connector out for wireless earphones to plug into.2 HDMI jacks are OK, but 3 or 4 would be better.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Joseph E Cicero
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive before it arrived but that all changed as soon as it was tuned to a TV channel. It has a beautiful picture and easy to use controls. The best Television for the money that I ever owned. orecic

Reviews.Title: Poor black levels and too reflective
Reviews.Author: MartinP
Reviews.Content: The LG 60PN6500 was by far the best value for money Plasma I could find at the price. I was looking at a Plasma TV again after having used a LED TV for the past 3 years and being disappointed at the poor black levels it displayed and issues with uneven backlighting. Plasma TVs also appeared to me to have more natural colours and no issues with uneven backlighting or backlight bleeding. After demo'ing the 60" TV in store we were ready to purchase the TV as the sharpness and vivid colours looked really great and the image quality was certainly a notch above similarly priced LED TVs. There were some issues with reflections in the showroom and selecting the Cinema preset revealed it not bright enough for brightly lit rooms, but most electronics stores will have issues with this and we argued that most of our TV watching will be during the evening.Getting home and unpacking the TV one is instantly reminded that this is one heavy TV so definitely make sure that you have someone around to assist you with unpacking and installation. Seems like I have been spoiled a bit by the lighter LED TVs I have used in the past. Setting it up in our room, unfortunately revealed that the TV reflected nearly every bit of light source that was around in the room, but this was better during the evenings. The TV also had a tendency to reflect our ambient lighting installed in the ceilings that is located in the back of the room and we ended up watching most of our demo material in a nearly dark room that would have been a more fitting setting for a projector.After watching a movie, both my wife and I suffered from headaches and we set the brightness lower. It is also here that the LG revealed its worst shortcoming, poor black levels. On the plus side I was extremely pleased with the colours on this television and episodes of BBC's Life series were pin sharp, however I wasn't able to overcome the poor black levels by playing around with the settings. The TV also exhibited some pixel noise present in dark scenes with one of my test discs (Dredd) that was very noticeable and bordering on annoying. In some instances during dark scenes, the TV appeared to turn the display off for a fraction until there was enough brightness in the picture again to force itself to switch back on again. I can imagine that some people would find this very annoying. We couldn't find any settings in the menu to force the TV to remain on. The TV displayed no issues with moving images and I think sports viewers would be thrilled with this set.All in all for the price this is a decent Plasma TV if you can negate the reflections and secondly if your primary use is for general television and sports viewing. As a TV for movies it falls short of the mark. If you can deal with the pentile matrix on the 60" Samsung F5500, I would suggest that you definitely add it to your comparison list. The Panasonic P60UT50 remains the best quality Plasma TV I've seen so far, but from reviews here on Amazon, Panasonic appears to suffer from quality issues.Unfortunately we returned the LG TV the next day and will save up my money for a more expensive LED TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Plasma For The Money
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Went thought the 100 hour recommended break in period and the picture looks great. For the price, I never thought I'd get a 60" tv with this great a picture for under $1000. I followed the advice from another reviewer on properly calibrating the picture to achieve the best picture. His settings were spot on. Would recommend this set to anyone that asks.

Reviews.Title: Best plasma around!!!
Reviews.Author: D. Burns
Reviews.Content: I didn't buy from amazon but got it from microcenter for $599!!! (Got it on 1/4/14) This tv is absolutely awesome. If you don't care about having a smart tv or 3d tv then pick this tv up. It's huge, it's super thin and barely any bezel. The picture quality is amazing. Only drawback is that it only has 2 hdmi ports but you can pick up an hdmi switch from amazon super cheap. I won't write too much but see the ratings for this tv. Check out the ratings on microcenter as well. Ratings on both sites speaks for themselves.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV with cheap price!
Reviews.Author: Syed S. Raza
Reviews.Content: First 60" for me and I can say Wow! LG really does make nice panel.Its a no-nonsense TV with no 3d, smart features, but has all the components with USBHooked up my chromecast and enjoying 1080p youtube, netflix like those "other" smart TVs.

Reviews.Title: good price
Reviews.Author: frank s "frank"
Reviews.Content: this is a big TV with an excellent picture at a very reasonable price. I prefer the picture on plasma TVs over LED/LCD TVs and this TV doesn't disappoint. Great contrast and deep blacks.

Reviews.Title: the big screen
Reviews.Author: scottrt
Reviews.Content: not bad...got it on my wall works great very compatible with the rest of my system.What more can I say but its everything I wanted in a big screen.the one small neg..is it picks up a lot of back ground reflections..

Reviews.Title: Good tv/Good price
Reviews.Author: C. Arellano
Reviews.Content: Great television if you receive hd channels, which I'll assume most people do. It has two hdmi connections, which is not a problem for me, tv control is not an issue as most reviewers have stated otherwise. I would definitely recommend anyone to purchase this television. P.s I purchased this television from Paul's tv, I've made two purchases from them thru amazon, and since I live in Southern California, it gets delivered straight from them, both times I've had issues with their delivery people. After having this tv for several months, my electricity bill went up significantly, the television gets very hot, I unplug it overnight, as well as when I go to work.

Reviews.Title: Life is Not that Good
Reviews.Author: Johnny G
Reviews.Content: Ordered TV in October 2013.  Arrived and set up perfect.  Great picture, easy to use remote and interactive guide.  Not a problem until May 2014, where loss of signal was do to a broken HDMI port on the side of the TV.  Connector is soldered to a circuit board with no strain relief.  The weight of the top of the line HDMI cable broke the port off the pcb.After calling LG for a repair, the technician's arrived and claimed it to be physical abuse and would NOT be covered under warranty.  The estimate to repair the port was $250.  Ridiculous.  So the $25 HDMI switch is now in use.The bad news for LG is that I am shopping for new kitchen appliances, and cannot in good conscience keep them in consideration.  Good TV, poor HDMI port design, apathetic customer service, rigid service policy.  Avoid LG if possible.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Brady G. Murray "Brady"
Reviews.Content: Great Picture, good sound. No complaints. I am a PLASMA fan and have been. Great bang for the buck. Shipped on time.

Reviews.Title: LG Plasma TV review.
Reviews.Author: Laurence Schneider
Reviews.Content: Its as good a TV picture as I have every seen.  Controls and operation are simple.  It's everything a TV should be.

Reviews.Title: Amazing tv; great price.
Reviews.Author: Dbaucom82
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful tv for the price. No disappointments. Lighter than my old 42" plasma; but you'll need 2-3 people to install on wall mount. Easy to install and setup. Great picture and is a good upgrade if you are ready for it. Most of the reviews I found are positive and I can see why.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Guth
Reviews.Content: This TV was a great deal only reason I gave it four stars and not five is because I found the smart version for the same price. The clarity of the TV while playing video games is excellent and watching movies too. I bought this TV because I game a lot and it is perfect for gaming. 600 Hz TVs are the best for gaming and for the price you will not find one that even comes close to it.

Reviews.Title: Great screen, Quick, safe delivery
Reviews.Author: Butterita
Reviews.Content: This came in like 1week of ordering, was delivered and set up by the deliverer, and has been a great television for our family room. I was skeptical about a large purchase via Amazon, but my hesitations subsided with this experience. Also the price was better than any for this model or size!

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Will Slade
Reviews.Content: Not the VERY best picture I've ever seen but definitely very good - and for the price, pretty much unbeatable. I do kinda wish I'd gone with the smart version, but there again the price on this thing has been absolutely unbeatable. Even the crap TV's stores were selling on Black Friday weren't much cheaper. Overall I'm very happy with my purchase and with Google's Chromecast it's getting more and more like a smart TV everyday! I originally had this rated at 4 stars but decided that based on my search for price vs performance this is a 5 star product.

Reviews.Title: AWSOME! FROM START TO FINISH
Reviews.Author: jennifer helton
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews and this is by far 5 times better than my previous 60" TV. The pitcher is like what you see in the stores. I recommend this to everyone, we are going to give two away at our Association Christmas Party this year.

Reviews.Title: A Must Buy
Reviews.Author: A. black
Reviews.Content: I had three other HD televisions in my house all with HD inputs.  When i set this up my kid was watching a SD channel.  My wife who was watching me set it up, said wow.  Then I switched to ESPNHD and and went wow again.  Angry that I didn't swap to it earlier from DLP & LCD.

Reviews.Title: WOW that's a big one
Reviews.Author: BRYCE A BENSEMA
Reviews.Content: I was a bit reluctant to buy such a large and expensive item online but Amazon wowed me again.  I saved $450, had free delivery that was on time and quickly accomplished.  The quality is amazing.  I'm going to add a sound bar to add depth to the already full sound.

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality for the price!
Reviews.Author: Norma Llanos
Reviews.Content: It is a great TV. The colors are vivid and the screen seems so much bigger than 60". Love it!

Reviews.Title: Impressive!
Reviews.Author: Dorothy B. Lagdameo "Rodrigo Lagdameo"
Reviews.Content: Better than I Expected. Quality seems to get better as more hours are watch on this brilliant TV. Absolutely incredible picture!

Reviews.Title: it's easy  to use
Reviews.Author: john kempf
Reviews.Content: I wanted a Plasma that was easy to navigate without all the extras that the smart TV's have but with all the picture qualities that they do and this one fit the bill. The Amazon price was the best price I could find in the web.

Reviews.Title: Our first flat screen TV - how did we live without it?
Reviews.Author: Kari A. Carlisle
Reviews.Content: We've owned an old big box TV (32 inch) for the last 10 years or so. When we moved recently, we refused to move that big beast and finally bought a flat screen. Hubby did the research, and we decided on this one. No regrets. Whether we watch during the day or at night, the picture is great.

Reviews.Title: Worth the $750 price point
Reviews.Author: Carey
Reviews.Content: This TV is beautiful. Definitely worth the cheaper price with just as much quality as any other TV out there.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: R. Bennett
Reviews.Content: Have had TV for one month am I am very pleased. I think this is an excellent price for a TV of this size and plasma works wells in my downstairs room with few windows. I do wish there was least one more HDMI port but with one on the side it is easy to switch.I get my "smart TV" needs from external devices. My first TV arrived with a broken screen but I refused delivery and Amazon had a new TV delivered by a different company within a few days.

Reviews.Title: Great 60-inch to own.
Reviews.Author: Jay Peterson
Reviews.Content: Great TV everything described before purchase and more!  Only issue is it only has two HDMI port connections.  Otherwise a great investment.

Reviews.Title: Well Worth It
Reviews.Author: Amer
Reviews.Content: To my untrained eyes, this looks just as good as more expensive LED TVs.My other TV is 55-inch LED Smart TV. That TV was more than $1500. That is awesome TV too but when watching movies in dark, black areas in the scene will have "light clouds". (I think that's the right term but I am not sure.) On this TV, dark scenes are just dark and beautiful. I know that is one advantage of plasma vs LED/LCD.Also there is a noticeable difference between 55-inch vs 60-inch TV. I wasn't expecting that but that was a pleasant surprise and pictures look really big.I use Cinema mode and pictures look great. I tried using various settings suggested here for better picture quality but my eyes cannot tell the difference so I stick with Cinema mode.Last I spend $35 on Chromecast and now we can watch Netflix on this TV without spending 100s more for a smart TV.Just one issue with delivery. Amazon's delivery description said that they will deliver TV to any room and set it up. But when the guys came, they said as long as the room is on the first floor. They were nice and delivered it to desired room, however, I felt bad for them. Someone should either revise description here or update their contract with delivery company.Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: love love love !!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love my new TV bright  vivid color and absolutely love the sound system in TV ! NO regret at all and delivery guys were so helpful also ! Love LG product !

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV FOR THE PRICE
Reviews.Author: Gary Feduccia
Reviews.Content: Wow, got my new LG 60PN6500 TV a week or so ago and had my Son help me with installing it above the biggest ZVox sound bar available.  Gosh, my Wife came in and screamed, more or less, that I had screwed-up the living room!  Darn, took her 3 or 4 days to calm down and accept the new TV!  What wonderful resolution from the movies we get . . . . .Wonderful, wonderful TV, once you set the calibrations.  See the reviews for this TV for suggestions.  Too the ZVox is pretty good with sound levels, but I do appreciate the, "sound leveling" and the setting to get voice over ambient sounds.  These two settings made my choice for the ZVox.  Commercials are no longer so loud (sound leveling) and on the other setting, the ambient sound is lessened, so that you can ACTUALLY HEAR voices in the movie.Wonderful combo!PUHLEESED with the whole package,  Gary

Reviews.Title: 60 inch plasma, this is how its done
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I own 2 of this model. 3 HDMI inputs, and perfect picture for me. BTW, 3D at home is for sissies. Does any rational adult actually sit in their own house wearing those stupid glasses? Amazing if true.For anyone that thinks LED is a better picture, with that 3D and tru-motion garbage that basically ruins the picture, I invite you to sit and watch Inception side by side, LED vs Plasma, and tell yourself which one looks like the true cinema experience. Its not LED, unless you just like lying to yourself. LED has its advantages in sports, because of the crispness of the picture, but not in the cinema experience. Just because the lines are more defined doesn't mean the picture is what you need it to be. For people that have not actually compared LED vs Plasma, go to a store like Brandsmart or Frye's have them put in a movie for you from Bluray. You'll see the difference immediately.that's my 2 cents.David in ATL

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!
Reviews.Author: J. S.
Reviews.Content: The picture is excellent.  Even standard definition over cable and DVDs look excellent.  It comes with a picture wizard that helps you set up the ideal picture settings.  The wizard is VERY easy to use.Equipped with Simplelink.  This worked with my Panasonic Blu-Ray Player.  Can control the Blu-Ray player with the TV remote.Sound is excellent.  It has surround sound and True Voice.  Both sound great.  Voice dialog is very clear.  This is the first TV I haven't had to constantly turn up and down the volume for people talking and actions scenes.One HDMI input is on the back, the rest are on the left side of the TV.Highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Plasma at last
Reviews.Author: Sarah Derr
Reviews.Content: LG thanks for making a great 60" plasma TV that I can afford.This unit has everything i needed and not a bunch of features I did not want to pay for.The video quality is amazing.  For the size of the speakers the sound is remarkable.  Add your own sound system and you are set.Get it while it lasts.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for sports and games
Reviews.Author: Campy
Reviews.Content: I researched which kind of TV to get for some time. I bought a Sharp LED thinking the LED was the best thing. Ended up returning that TV because I wasn't a fan of the fake looking images. Then bought a Panasonic GT50, last years high end plasma, and didn't like it because of the fake look even with being a plasma. I wanted something natural like my 47" LCD LG TV from 6 years ago.The sharp LED was not good with sports. I'm a huge football fan, and I could not stand the pixilated look. Fast movements became a little blurry on some plays. It was 240hz, but with it being a 60" TV, you could still see it. On a smaller TV, maybe not so much. Some video games would skip, just didn't like it.Bottom line, this LG TV has a great picture. Sports on it look amazing, and no issues like the LED TV. And for the price difference of the GT50, I would take this TV. Only plus for the GT50, is it has a filter on the front of the screen so has much less glare, but to me is not worth the extra money. The glare is the only downfall to this TV but honestly is not near as bad as they say. Sometimes you notice it but then you find yourself looking right past it. Just something to get used to and is worth it for the price. The picture is great and is smooth moving, and don't have the fake look like those LED TVs. If you don't need a smart TV, or 3d this is the best route to go. The PN6700 is the same thing as this just the smart version.If you don't like how all the LED TVs look, want something great for sports, video games and everyday watching this is the TV to get. Love this TV and would buy another one, as this is my first plasma. You will not be disappointed. Also, some people say it looks grainy, which if you are a foot away, yes it does. But if you are 10-12ft away like me, great picture. Well worth every penny, no issues with home theater or anything. Hope this helps anyone looking for a new TV.

Reviews.Title: Buy it!!!
Reviews.Author: Robert Trigg
Reviews.Content: Not bad for just a plain TV ( non 3d or smart). Refresh rate is really good. I paid $848. I would buy this plasma if your looking for a 60" under a grand!!!!

Reviews.Title: Completes my Man-cave
Reviews.Author: Andrew Paquette
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for all of about 24 hours, and it has not disappointed.  With this TV I was a little skeptical because of all the burn in issues I'd heard about plasmas over the years (hopefully I can update down the road to see what my thoughts are should I experience anything like that), but have been hearing such good things about the picture quality so I decided to take the plunge.  I'm no videophile so I'm not going to post my settings or rave about deep blacks or anything like that but below is a quick pro/con list of what I've noticed in my brief time with the TV:Positives:- Price - Sorry all I'm a cheapskate at heart, so when I was able to get this for $750 with free delivery compared to the sets running over $1000, I jumped!- Size - I was looking for a big screen and got that with the 60 inch, but was floored when I saw how thin this was, and is this bad boy ever thin!- Picture - OK so I know I just went on about how I'm no videophile, but man maybe it's just bias because this is my TV, but I've never had a TV picture look this good in my life. - No Smart TV/3D - At this point I feel these features are superfluous, I have my TV connected to my PS3, so if I need to get Netflix, Amazon Video, Huly etc I'll just use that.  Also I've never been a fan of 3D, just an overpriced gimmick in my view.Negatives:- HDMI - There are only two (2) HDMI ports, which kind of sucks, but for my use that's enough for now (one for my DirecTV box and the other for my PS3), but I suppose should you need more you can get a switcher to add extra ports.- Energy Consumption - In comparison to an LED, this will cost you a bit more, something along the lines of $15 - $20 a year.- Weight - Yes, this thing is pretty heavy.  The page says 83 pounds, but I'm thinking close to 90, so it's not going to be something you want to move a lot, and you will need a good sturdy stand.So to wrap this all up, hopefully I'll be able to add more to this as I get more time using the TV, but this is a no-frills TV that has a great picture and looks great in the basement.  Happy hunting to anyone reading this and good luck!

Reviews.Title: Great picture!!
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Gooder
Reviews.Content: We love this tv... the picture is wonderful and it was a great price as well.  Your carrier was awesome, set the whole thing up with your "white glove" delivery.  5 stars to CEVA transport!  We would definately buy this tv again!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value (Revised to a Maybe)
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: If you're in the market for a TV without all the smart stuff, the web surfing, the stream services, etc...and if you don't need more than 2 HDMI inputs this is the set for you. After some picture adjustments on the 3 sources I'm using. The picture is absolutely great, and under $1K.  After the problems I had with my Sony SXRD I decided to replace my orange out of warranty friend for this one.Update after 3 months:Well the tuner stop working, and had to make a service call. They said that they will replace the main board, and that should fix it. After that I did a search on "LG Plasma TV tuner not working" and found out that I'm not the only one. At least I'm still under the manufacture warranty. The service department was helpful and I had no problems getting in-home service so far. I took one star off of my rating since I'm having problems with my 3 month old TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Super Price
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Odette "Lady Rider"
Reviews.Content: To be fair, I can only comment on the quality of the tv, which has a better pic than our 55" Hitachi.  As far as getting it up on the wall mount, programming the remote, etc., NOT my department.  I online shop for the best reviews for the buck, and this totally filled the bill when you consider FREE shipping, NO taxes and DELIVERED right to you.  Amazon, when you do it right, you do it great!

Reviews.Title: Way better than expected!
Reviews.Author: RTB "Hkrn"
Reviews.Content: We were shopping around for a new 60" LCD for our media room and came across the LG Plasma HDTV here at Amazon.com. All of our other TV's are LG and decided to branch out and look at Sony's and Panasonics but they were a bit more expensive. Most of the reviews we saw for the LG said the picture quality was outstanding so we bought it.We had a 10 year old Sony DVD player and plugged it in and were not impressed with the picture quality. The Sony outputs RBG so we decided to try our Sony laptops HDMI output and then "Holy Cow" it was awesome! The picture looked exactly like the laptop, only bigger. We were immediately impressed and then watched Avatar, Iron Man, Star Trek, Curse of the Golden Flower, Hero (Jet Li). The picture was bright and clear with brilliant colors.We noticed that if we set the LG's picture to "Game" we get an exact replica of what you see on your laptop. We've been leaving it set there but have also tried the "Cinema" setting and that's pretty darn good too! We're waiting for our new Sony Blue-ray player to arrive from Amazon then our media room will be nearly complete.You won't be sorry if you buy it; we're not.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: Donna Nicastro
Reviews.Content: It is a wonderful TV, it has a clear picture and great sound - we are very happy with our purchase!

Reviews.Title: best bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: if you are not worried about having a smat tv and 3d capabilities, this is your best bet.  excellent  picture quality, etc.if you want minimal smart tv features like streaming video and music spend a few dollars on a blu ray player.  works like a dream.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Satisfied buyer
Reviews.Content: Awesome picture and overall look of the tv. Free shipping from amazon in a two hour window was an added bonus and so much easier than most big items you need to be home to receive. Great value for what you're getting, plasma is so much better than LED. LED's are a waste of money because I find the soap opera effect unbearable. Highly recommend if you're looking for a big plasma tv

Reviews.Title: Seems That People Who Give High Ratings To This Product Have Never Tried Panasonic
Reviews.Author: Horse&Musket "wnmiii"
Reviews.Content: Positives: This is a lot of plasma for the money, and despite the cons below, by just being an adequate plasma, still blows away LED and LCD, especially for sports, but also movies (and I just covered 80% of my viewing). After having our basement finished, I chose this based on price, where it will be used strictly for occasional "light" viewing, probably mostly TV sports, and where the reflection problems that so many mention, aren't much of an issue.Negatives: Have an upper-mid-range Panasonic in our family room, where most viewing will continue to occur. The Panasonic shows this thing out as the mediocrity it was meant to be; built to a price instead of to a quality.Absolutely no comparison in brightness, contrast, blacks, color accuracy and consistency. Inadequate connections on the LG. And if specs are to be believed, 40% shorter half-life on the LG.Summary: My emotional side says I should have spent more on a Panasonic while I still could. My logical side says this unit is "good enough" for where it is, and for being a secondary viewing station. It sure is too bad that so few people are prepared to pay for quality. The junk from LG and Samsung has succeeded in driving Panasonic out of the market.

Reviews.Title: OUTSTANDING
Reviews.Author: J.A.Robbins,Jr.
Reviews.Content: This is the second LG plasma set I have owned.  The first set was a marvel - it wore out because of age.  The new set performs as well as the first, if not even better!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Plasma
Reviews.Author: Paul J. Esposito
Reviews.Content: I have had this product for two days now and have thoroughly enjoyed watching. Everything about this TV is great, picture, sound, color. I would recommend this product to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Good TV. Great shipping service
Reviews.Author: TJ
Reviews.Content: TV is perfect for what I was looking for. Shipping and Handling was great. Didn't have to figure out how to get it home either.

Reviews.Title: Research paid off
Reviews.Author: Christopher M Lozaga
Reviews.Content: If you want great black levels but do not want to spend a fortune on OLED or a 2000 dollar plasma, this is television for you. I did a ton of research - buyer beware, LG sells a 60 inch with an inferior panel to this, be sure to get the PN or higher models.- Great Black Levels- Great Contrast- No burn-in- Easy to calibrateAs other reviewers may have noted you do need to turn off all power saving features (eco mode, etc.) to achieve the best picture.Doesn't have any smart TV features but that is okay with me, I have a Roku. Could not be happier with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: Dominick
Reviews.Content: I like the size the picture is great it would be better if it was wifi and a smart TV but for the price it is a good TV.

Reviews.Title: Only problem is the input jack locations
Reviews.Author: TheDewd
Reviews.Content: I like this TV a lot. It has a good picture and the setup was easy. My only real complaint is that all the component inputs and power cord plug into the back of the unit instead of on the side. This makes it a real pain in the a$$ to connect anything once the TV is mounted on the wall.

Reviews.Title: Great deal for a beaut tv
Reviews.Author: Sarah Gaeta
Reviews.Content: So far so good. Definitely a great deal. TV is a beauty, great picture. Also took the tips of the first two reviews to set up picture. Also thought the delivery was a bit strange, only one guy who wasn't sure if he was going to be able to carry the tv on his own but he ended up doing so. I was a bit nervous he was going to drop it though and I think he was as well. All in all good experience though and no complaints on the product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome huge TV
Reviews.Author: Rene Vallieres
Reviews.Content: I did not think it was going to be much bigger than the LG 50" it replaced but it is a lot bigger.  So far great picture and the sound is better than my old LG.  I used some of the suggestions from other reviewers to set the picture and it did help, still playing with it a bit though.  The only thing I wish it had was a couple more HDMI inputs.  Otherwise it is a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Good price for a 60in plasma TV
Reviews.Author: carlos martinez
Reviews.Content: My first plasma TV and no issues so far. I've owned this TV for 2 months and it works just fine. For the price and size I can say its worth it. Some screen calibration needed but overall the display is fine.

Reviews.Title: Good - 4 Star
Reviews.Author: aussie
Reviews.Content: It was everything I expected.  Has all that I want in a TV. Rate it a 4 star purchase  out of 5

Reviews.Title: Decent price but picture is not great
Reviews.Author: Scott A. Napierala "Scott"
Reviews.Content: This is a decent deal for the price, but do not expect a great picture. The sound is average, at best. If you want an inexpensive TV for the basement, it will work fine.

Reviews.Title: Delivery pickup
Reviews.Author: Raeford Burnette
Reviews.Content: I was shipped this unit broken on dec,5, 2013. I tried contacting the delivery driver after leaving a few minutes the same day dec, 5th and was told by driver to contact office and he upon appointment would come and pick up tv and bring another container to send it back and so I could get a refund, but that never happened. Instead this company JB Hunt gave me the run around with different call back numbers, different people to talk too, and each time telling me that the driver would contact me, but it never happened. Instead I finally decided around Christmas time too look and see about getting another tv even though I still had this broken one, but I was blessed and managed to find a new one of the same make and a little cheaper and so I got it and was happy, but still I hadn't heard from the driver. So around beginning of jan. Ist decided to see about shipping the unit back myself, and it cost me around $161.00 to do this and I finally was sent a refund only in the amount I had paid to get this tv to start with. Still I am thankful that I got most of my money back instead of nothing.

Reviews.Title: Awesome picture
Reviews.Author: Simon
Reviews.Content: I chose this rating because I was mislead a little by the 600hz.  It is my own fault for not fully researching the product.

Reviews.Title: Decent while it worked, but dead after 2 days
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: For the price the picture quality was good in the short time it worked.  But the TV started powering off and on randomly after an hour or two of use.  It would rapidly power down, then come back on for a few seconds, then go off again.  Repeat.  Repeat.  After a half dozen on/off cycles, it would power off for a good 10-15 minute break before turning on again.  This set appears to be a dud.Aside from that, the PQ is really good for a model in this price range.  It does need a very dark room to perform well, as any ambient light will be reflected.  The last 2 plasmas I owned were not quite this light sensitive/reflective.

Reviews.Title: For the price, you can't beat it.
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Not as good as LED, but for the price difference it's great for those who can't spend $1,800.00 and up for a 60 in. LED.  Does take some work to find a good picture tune that works with all sources. Works best in low light rooms. Even with a 400hz refresh rate, there is still some motion blur, really expected better. Do invest in quality High Speed HDMI cables.

Reviews.Title: Great....except for
Reviews.Author: oktoak
Reviews.Content: the fact that a small piece was missing when we received this.  We actually bought 2 LGs in the same week.  The 50 inch seemed to be good quality, and I guess we assumed LG is an upstanding company.  I called LG about a small plastic piece that holds the cord on the back of the TV.  I was told that one would be shipped to me, and I would receive it in 5 to 7 days.  Today (5 days later) I received a message that the piece would not be sent out.  Based on the grammar of the call, I'm sure that when the caller said that "shipping the part would be a courtesy, so we are not sending it out", that's not actually what he meant.  My husband called, and was told by a supervisor that the part would not be sent.  Amazon is great with returns, and he wanted to return it, but I don't want to stuff it in the box and go to the hassle.  We're looking for new SS appliances.  They won't be from LG.  After all, what if one of them was missing a critical part and not just a 25 cent piece of plastic?

Reviews.Title: ehhh
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: should have looked at features better its only got two hdmi's....thats my cable and blu-ray....have to buy a hub just for my xboxawesome for hd football though!!!

Reviews.Title: Home theatre headache
Reviews.Author: Stephen S. Clement
Reviews.Content: Received this 60" plasma tv today and right from the get go problems. First the remote was hard to use, tv didn't respond to the set up menu, finally the delivery man started screwing around with manual controls and remote started working. Secondly, this tv can not be directly connected using HDMI cables through my home theatre unit, which means you have to connect your set top box and blue-ray units to the two available HDMI connections, then you need audio-optical cables to get sound, this means if you  have a XBOX you have to either switch out the connections from one of the other components to the XBOX, in other words the switching that is usually done by selection through the Home Theatre unit is not available with this tv and you need additional cables. In addition to these problems, the delivery people sent only one man, this tv is very large and I found myself going out and helping to carry it in in fear that I might be damaged before I could even inspect it. A true nightmare.

Reviews.Title: hdmi ports
Reviews.Author: Richard G. Hill
Reviews.Content: Only has 2 hdmi ports which makes it hard to hook up more that one extra item. Had I looked before I bought I would have bought something different. Look before you buy!!!!!! Will not work with my Apple Tv. Do not like this set.
